TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
Water sample is collected from a pond.
The collected water sample is closed and is labeled as “Water sample”.
The water sample is placed on the Work bunch.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
10ml of water sample is taken using glass pipette.
And is transferred to the Conical flask named as :TEST 1”.
Similarly 10ml water sample is transferred to both “TEST 2” and “TEST 3”.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
10ml of Distilled water is taken using glass pipette.
The bottle is closed and is transferred to the Conical flask named as :BLANK 1”.
Similarly 10ml water sample is transferred to both “BLANK 2” and “BLANK 3”.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
The bottle containing potassium dichromate solution is opened and 5ml of the solution is taken from it.
5ml of potassium dichromate solution is added to the first conical flask labeled as “TEST 1”.
Similarly 5ml of potassium dichromate solution is transferred to all conical flasks.
All conical flasks are wrapped with aluminum foil.
The “TEST 1” conical flask is taken from the table.
And is placed in a boiling water bath.
Similarly, all the six conical flasks are placed in the boiling water bath.
Similarly, all the six conical flasks are placed in the boiling water bath.
The water bath is closed and is incubated for 1 hour.
After 1 hour, the water bath is opened and “Test 1” is taken out from it.
And is placed on the table.
Similarly, all the six conical flasks were taken out from the water bath.
And is placed at room temperature for 10 minutes.
The aluminum foil is removed from all the conical flask.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
The bottle containing potassium iodide solution is opened and 5ml of the solution is transferred from it.
And is transferred to the “TEST 1” conical flask.
Similarly 5ml of potassium iodide solution is transferred to all conical flasks.
10ml glass pipette is taken from the pipette stand.
And is connected with a pipette pump.
The bottle containing Sulfuric acid is opened and 10ml of the solution is transferred from it.
And is transferred to the “TEST 1” conical flask.
Similarly 5ml of Sulfuric acid is transferred to all conical flasks.
Titration : Blank
50 ml burette is attached to the burette stand and the funnel is taken from the table.
The funnel is inserted into the mouth of the burette.
The standard flask containing 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate is opened.
The burette is filled with 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate solution through the funnel.
The burette is filled with 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate solution through the funnel.
The funnel is removed from the mouth of the burette.
“ BLANK 1” is taken from the work bunch.
And is placed on the stirrer.
The magnetic stirrer is taken from the watch glass.
And is put into the “BLANK 1”.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on.
The stopper of the burette is opened for the dropwise addition of 0.1N sodium thiosulphate.
The color of the solution changes from orange to pale yellow color due to the drop wise addition of sodium thiosulphate.
Stop cock of the burette is closed immediately during the time at which the color of the solution changes to pale yellow color.
Starch solution is taken from its bottle using dropper.
3 drops of starch solution is added to the “ BLANK 1”.
Stop cock of the burette is opened for the drop wise addition of the 0.1N sodium thiosulphate and is closed immediately in the time at which the blue color of the solution is changes to colorless.
The magnetic stirrer is switched off.
The burette reading is shown as 22.
This experiment is repeated with “BLANK 2” and “BLANK 3” and the readings are noted.
Titration : Test
50 ml burette is attached to the burette stand and the funnel is taken from the table.
The funnel is inserted into the mouth of the burette.
The standard flask containing 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate is opened.
The burette is filled with 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate solution through the funnel.
The burette is filled with 0.1N Sodium thiosulphate solution through the funnel.
The funnel is removed from the mouth of the burette.
“ TEST 1” is taken from the work bunch.
And is placed on the stirrer.
The magnetic stirrer is taken from the watch glass.
And is put into the “TEST 1”.
The magnetic stirrer is switched on.
The stopper of the burette is opened for the dropwise addition of 0.1N sodium thiosulphate.
The color of the solution changes from orange to pale yellow color due to the drop wise addition of sodium thiosulphate.
Stop cock of the burette is closed immediately during the time at which the color of the solution changes to pale yellow color.
Starch solution is taken from its bottle using dropper.
3 drops of starch solution is added to the “ TEST 1”.
Stop cock of the burette is opened for the drop wise addition of the 0.1N sodium thiosulphate and is closed immediately at the time in which the blue color of the solution is changes to colorless.
The magnetic stirrer is switched off.
The burette reading is shown as 30.
This experiment is repeated with “TEST 2” and “TEST 3” and the readings are noted.
Calculation.
